docs.title: Welcome to Dino
docs.text: Dino is a web-based platform for structured data collection, monitoring, and analysis. It gives teams a single place to design forms, gather information from the field, track progress, and explore results — whether you are online or working in low-connectivity environments.

docs.title: What You Can Do with Dino
Collect Data
docs.text:
Design form schemas and use them to record information from the field. Forms can have multiple sections, support file and audio attachments, and follow workflow stages (statuses) as entries move through a process. Submissions can be filtered, exported, and visualised on a map.

  • Filling In a Form
  • Viewing & Managing Submissions
  • Exploring Data on a Map

docs.title: Analyse with AI
docs.text:
Ask plain-language questions about your collected data using the built-in AI assistant. Get answers as text, tables, or charts — no technical knowledge required.

  • Chatting with Your Data

docs.title: Stay Informed
docs.text:
Receive in-app notifications from the system or your administrator. Click a notification to be taken directly to the relevant area of the application.

  • Notifications

docs.title: Share Forms Publicly
docs.text:
Share a form with anyone via a direct link — no account required. Useful for collecting responses from people outside your organisation.

  • Filling In a Public Form

docs.title: Administer the Platform
docs.text:
Administrators can manage user accounts and permission groups, and control the translations shown throughout the interface.

  • Managing Users & Groups
  • Managing Languages

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
If this is your first time using Dino, start here:

  1. Logging In — sign in to your account, or request access from your administrator.
  2. Resetting Your Password — set a new password if you have been locked out.

docs.title: Access and Permissions
docs.text: What you can see and do in Dino depends on the permission groups assigned to your account. Some areas — such as administration and form schema management — are only visible to users with the appropriate role. If you cannot find a feature described in this documentation, contact your system administrator.

docs.title: Managing Languages
docs.text:
The Languages page allows administrators to manage all the translated text used throughout Dino. From here, you can browse, edit, and add translations, manage which languages are available, and export translation files for backup or editing.

Administrator access only

This area is only visible to users with the Administrator role. If you cannot see it in the navigation, contact your system administrator.

docs.title: Browsing Translations
docs.text:
The main view shows a list of all translation entries. Each entry displays its key — the internal identifier used by the application — and, when a language is selected, the corresponding translated text.

A loading indicator is shown while the translation data is being fetched.

docs.title: Filtering the List
docs.text:
Two controls at the top of the page let you narrow down the entries shown:

  • Keyword search — type any word to filter entries whose key or translation contains that text. The list updates as you type.
  • Language selector — a row of buttons shows Key and one button for each available language. Click a language name to display that language's translations alongside each key. Entries with no translation for the selected language are shown as (No translation).

docs.title: Editing a Translation Entry
docs.text:
1. Click on any entry in the list to open the Edit Translation dialog.
  2. The dialog shows the key and a text field for each available language.
  3. Update the translations as needed.
  4. Click Save to apply your changes, or Undo to close without saving.

You can also permanently remove an individual entry from this dialog by clicking the Remove button. This deletes the translation key and all its associated translations.

Warning

Removing a translation entry is permanent. The key and all its language values will be deleted.

docs.title: Adding a New Translation Entry
docs.text:
Use this when you need to add a translation key that does not yet exist in the system.

  1. Click the + Translation button in the toolbar.
  2. The Add Translation dialog will open. It contains one text field for each currently active language.
  3. Enter the translation text for each language as needed.
  4. Click Save to add the new entry, or Undo to cancel.

A confirmation message will appear briefly after the entry has been saved.

docs.title: Managing Languages
docs.text:
Use this to add a new language, update an existing language's translations, or remove a custom translation set.

  1. Click the Language button in the toolbar.
  2. The Language Settings dialog will open. It shows a list of available languages and provides the following actions:

docs.title: Adding a New Language
docs.text:
1. Click the + button at the top of the dialog.
  2. A form will appear asking for a language label (the name that will appear in the interface, for example "French" or "fr").
  3. Optionally, upload a JSON translation file by clicking Add JSON and selecting a file from your device. The file's contents will be previewed before saving.
  4. Click Save to add the language, or Undo to cancel.

docs.title: Viewing an Existing Language
docs.text: Click a language name button to select it. The dialog will show a preview of all the translation keys and values currently stored for that language.

docs.title: Updating a Language's Translations
docs.text:
With a language selected, click Update translation to upload a new JSON file. The dialog will preview the changes — new keys added and modified keys — before you save.

  1. Click Update translation and select a JSON file from your device.
  2. Review the preview showing added and modified rows.
  3. Click Save to apply the update, or Undo to cancel.

docs.title: Removing a Custom Translation
docs.text:
With a language selected, click Remove custom translation to delete the custom translation data for that language.

Warning

This removes the custom translations for the selected language. The language itself may remain in the system but its customised content will be lost.

docs.title: Exporting Translations
docs.text:
You can download the translation data for any language as a JSON file.

  1. Click the Export button (download icon) in the toolbar.
  2. The Export dialog will open showing a list of available languages.
  3. Click the name of the language you want to export. A preview of its translation data will appear on the right.
  4. Click Download to save the file to your device.

docs.title: Managing Users & Groups
docs.text:
The Users area lets administrators manage who can access Dino and what they are allowed to do. It is divided into two sections: Users, for individual accounts, and Groups, for sets of permissions that can be assigned to multiple users at once.

Administrator access only

This area is only visible to users with the Administrator role. If you cannot see it in the navigation, contact your system administrator.

docs.title: Navigating the Users Area
docs.text:
When you open the Users area, you will see a menu with two options:

  • Users — manage individual user accounts.
  • Groups — manage permission groups.

Click either option to open the corresponding section.

docs.title: Browsing the User List
docs.text:
The Users list shows all accounts in the system, displaying each user's email address, full name, and a Disabled toggle indicating whether the account is currently active.

The total number of users matching your current filters is shown at the top of the list.

docs.title: Searching and Filtering
docs.text:
• Type in the keyword search field to filter users by any text in their details.
  • Use the From date and To date fields to filter by account creation date.
  • Use the User Groups filter to show only users who belong to a specific permission group.
  • Clear any filter by clicking the × icon inside that field.

docs.title: Enabling or Disabling a User
docs.text: Each row contains a toggle in the Disabled column. Click the toggle directly in the list to enable or disable a user account without opening the editor.

docs.title: Adding a New User
docs.text:
Note

Creating new accounts requires an active internet connection. If you are offline, the add button will show a connectivity icon and the action will not be available.

  1. Click the + button (floating button at the bottom-right of the page).
  2. A dialog will open. Fill in the following fields:
    • Full Name — required.
    • Email — required.
    • Password and Confirm Password — required in some installations (at least 9 characters).
    • User Permission Groups — select one or more groups from the dropdown to control what this user can access.
  3. Click Save to create the account.

A confirmation message will appear at the bottom of the screen when the user has been saved successfully.

docs.title: Editing a User
docs.text:
1. Find the user in the list and click the pencil icon on their row.
  2. The editor dialog will open in edit mode. You can update the Full Name and the User Permission Groups.
  3. Click Save to apply your changes, or Close to discard them.

docs.title: Viewing a User
docs.text: Click the eye icon on a user's row to open their details in read-only mode. No changes can be made in this mode. Click Close when done.

docs.title: Deleting a User
docs.text:
1. Click the delete icon on the user's row.
  2. A confirmation prompt will appear. Confirm to permanently delete the account.

Warning

Deleting a user account is permanent and cannot be undone.

docs.title: Groups
docs.text: Permission groups define what areas, forms, reports, and data a set of users can access. Assigning a user to a group grants them all the permissions defined for that group.

docs.title: Browsing the Groups List
docs.text: The Groups list shows all permission groups by name. The total count is shown at the top of the page.

docs.title: Searching and Filtering
docs.text:
• Use the keyword search field to filter groups by name.
  • Use the From date and To date fields to filter by creation date.
  • Use the metric filters (Project, Location, Thematic Area, Case, Organization) to find groups associated with specific data scopes.
  • Clear any filter by clicking the × icon inside that field.

docs.title: Adding a New Group
docs.text:
1. Click the + button (floating button at the bottom-right of the page).
  2. A dialog will open showing a categorised list of available items to assign to the group. Items are grouped into categories such as Roles, Form Schemas, Form Statuses, Report Schemas, and any active metric types.
  3. Enter a group name in the name field at the top of the dialog.
  4. Select the items you want to include in the group by clicking them. At least one Role must be selected before you can save.
  5. Click Save to create the group.

A confirmation message will appear with the group name when it has been saved.

docs.title: Editing a Group
docs.text:
1. Click the pencil icon on a group's row.
  2. The editor dialog will open with the group's current configuration pre-loaded.
  3. Update the name or add and remove items as needed. At least one Role must remain selected.
  4. Click Save to apply your changes.

docs.title: Viewing a Group
docs.text: Click the eye icon on a group's row to open its configuration in read-only mode. Click Close when done.

docs.title: Deleting a Group
docs.text:
1. Click the delete icon on the group's row.
  2. A confirmation prompt will appear. Confirm to permanently delete the group.

Warning

Deleting a group is permanent. Users who were only assigned to that group will lose the associated permissions immediately.

docs.title: "New User accounts cannot be created while offline."
docs.text:
Warning

Your device is not connected to the internet. New user accounts can only be created when online. Check your connection and try again. Editing and viewing existing users is still available while offline.

docs.title: "Oops! Something went wrong while saving the User."
docs.text:
Warning

The user could not be saved, possibly due to a validation error or a temporary server problem. Check that all required fields are filled in correctly and try again. If the problem persists, contact your system administrator.

docs.title: "Oops! Something went wrong while performing the requested action."
docs.text:
Warning

This message can appear when saving or deleting a group. It may indicate a server-side issue or a conflict with existing data. Try again after a moment. If the problem continues, contact your system administrator.

docs.title: Aggregation
docs.text: The Aggregation page provides a unified view of all form submissions across your organization. Instead of viewing submissions for one form schema at a time, you can see entries from multiple schemas together in a single, filterable list.

docs.title: Browsing the List
docs.text:
The list displays all submissions you have permission to view. Each row represents a single submission. The following columns are shown by default:

  • Form Schema: The name of the form schema this submission belongs to.
  • Status: The current workflow status of the submission.
  • Additional columns for metrics like Project, Location, or Organization may also appear, depending on your system's configuration.

You can click on any row to select it or expand it to see more details.

docs.title: Filtering the List
docs.text:
A filter bar is located above the list. Use it to narrow down the submissions shown. You can filter by:

  • Project
  • Location
  • Area
  • Case
  • Case Code
  • Organization
  • Form Status
  • User

Filtering Tips

The Aggregation filter bar is designed for quick, cross-schema filtering. For advanced features like saved filter presets or data export, navigate to the submissions list for a specific form schema.

docs.title: Row Actions
docs.text:
When you hover over a row, a set of action icons appears on the right. The actions available for a specific submission depend on your permissions for its form schema.

  • View (): Open the submission in a read-only view.
  • Edit (): Open the submission for editing.
  • Print (): Generate and open a PDF version of the submission. You will be asked to confirm before the PDF is created.
  • Delete (): Permanently delete the submission. You will be asked to confirm this action.

docs.title: Creating a New Submission
docs.text:
You can start a new form submission directly from the Aggregation page.

  1. Click the + (Add) button in the bottom-right corner of the screen.
  2. A dialog opens, showing a list of form schemas you have permission to create submissions for.
  3. Select the desired form schema from the list.
  4. Click Create Form. You will be taken to the form to begin filling it out.

docs.title: Checkout
docs.text: The Checkout page in Dino is where you finalize your payment for services, such as upgrading your subscription plan or purchasing additional features. This page uses a secure, integrated payment system to process your transaction.

docs.title: What You See
docs.text:
When you navigate to the Checkout page, you will see a secure payment form. This form is managed by Dino's payment partner and is designed to collect your payment details safely.

The page typically includes: * A summary of the item or subscription plan you are purchasing. * Fields to enter your payment information (e.g., card number, expiration date, CVC). * A button to complete the purchase.

docs.title: How to Complete a Purchase
docs.text:
Follow these steps to finalize your payment.

  1. Review your purchase details at the top of the checkout form.
  2. Enter your payment information into the secure fields provided.
  3. Click the "Pay" or "Subscribe" button to authorize the transaction.

Secure Payment

Your payment details are processed securely by our payment partner and are not stored directly within Dino. You will receive a confirmation email once the transaction is complete.

docs.title: After Checkout
docs.text:
Once your payment is successfully processed: * Your account will be immediately updated with the new service or subscription level. * You can return to the main application to begin using the new features. * You can view and manage your subscription from your account settings.

Failed Payments

If your payment fails, please verify your card details and ensure sufficient funds are available. Your account access will not change until a successful payment is completed.

docs.title: Dashboard
docs.text: The Dashboard is the first screen you see after logging in. It serves as your central hub for navigating Dino's features. Depending on your system configuration, it will appear in one of two layouts: a Menu Dashboard or a Report Dashboard.

docs.title: Menu Dashboard
docs.text:
In this layout, the Dashboard presents a grid of navigation cards. Each card provides quick access to a major area of the application that you have permission to use.

You will typically see the following cards:

  • Forms: Navigate to the Forms area to create new form schemas, collect data, and review submissions.
  • Reports: Navigate to the Reports area to create, view, and manage reports based on your collected data.
  • Metrics: Navigate to the Metrics area to manage reference data like projects, locations, and organizations. !!! warning "Visibility" The Metrics card is hidden if your user account has guest-only permissions.
  • Users: Navigate to the Users area to manage user accounts and groups. !!! tip "Admin Access" The Users card is only visible to users with administrator privileges.

To navigate, simply click on the card for the area you wish to access.

docs.title: Report Dashboard
docs.text: In this layout, your Dashboard is personalized to display a single report that you have marked as a favorite. This allows you to view key data visualizations immediately upon login.

docs.title: Setting a Favorite Report
docs.text:
If you have not yet selected a favorite report, you will see a welcome message prompting you to add one.

  1. Go to the Reports area.
  2. Open the report you want to see on your Dashboard.
  3. In the report list or report view, find and click the Add to favourites action (usually represented by a star icon).
  4. Refresh or return to your Dashboard. The selected report will now be displayed.

docs.title: Changing or Removing a Favorite
docs.text: To change your favorite report, simply add a different report to your favorites. The new report will replace the old one on your Dashboard. To clear the Dashboard, you can remove the favorite report setting from your browser's local storage, or contact your system administrator.

docs.title: Guided Tour
docs.text:
The first time you access Dino, a guided tour may automatically start from the Dashboard to introduce you to the application's main features.

  • You can follow the on-screen prompts to learn about navigation and key actions.
  • If you skip or finish the tour, you can restart it at any time from the help menu in the User Area.

docs.title: Data Collection
docs.text:
The Data Collection area is the central hub for all form-based data entry in Dino. From here you can access every form schema your team works with, submit new entries, review existing submissions, and explore collected data on a map or through AI-assisted analysis.

When you open the Data Collection area, you will see a list of all available form schemas. Each item in the list shows the form's name and icon.

docs.title: Navigating the Area
docs.text:
The main page shows all form schemas you have access to. You can interact with this list in several ways:

  1. Open a Form: Click on any form schema in the list to open its submissions list. This is where you can browse, add, or manage individual form entries.
  2. Search and Filter: Use the search bar at the top to quickly find a specific form by its name.
  3. Sort: Click on the column headers (like "Name") to sort the list.

Quick Access

The form list is your starting point for all data collection activities. Think of each form schema as a different type of report or survey you need to fill out.

docs.title: Working with a Form Schema
docs.text:
After selecting a form schema, you are taken to its dedicated page. Here, you can perform several key actions:

  1. View Submissions: See a table of all data previously submitted for this form.
  2. Create a New Submission: Click the Create button to fill out and submit a new form.
  3. Explore Data:
    • Click the Map tab to see all submissions plotted geographically.
    • Click the DataChat tab to ask questions about your collected data using AI.

docs.title: To submit new data:
docs.text:
1. From the main Data Collection page, click on the desired form schema.
  2. On the form's submission list page, click the Create button.
  3. Fill out all required fields in the form that opens.
  4. Click Submit to save your entry.

docs.title: To review existing data:
docs.text:
1. From the main Data Collection page, click on the relevant form schema.
  2. Browse the list of submissions. You can click on any individual entry to View its details or Edit it if you have permission.

Managing Form Schemas

Creating and editing the structure of form schemas (adding fields, changing questions) requires additional permissions. If you need to set up a new form or modify an existing one, see Managing Form Schemas or contact your administrator.

docs.title: Chatting with Your Data (AI)
docs.text:
The Data Chat page lets you ask plain-language questions about the submissions collected for a form. The AI assistant analyses the data and returns answers in text, tables, or charts.

Optional feature

This feature requires a DataChat API key and may not be available in your installation. If you cannot see this option, contact your administrator.

docs.title: Accepting the Terms of Use
docs.text:
The first time you use Data Chat, you will be shown a terms of use statement. Read it and click Accept to continue.

Your acceptance is saved on your device, so you will not be asked again on future visits.

docs.title: Entering Your API Key
docs.text:
After accepting the terms, you will be asked to enter your DataChat API key.

  1. Type your API key into the field.
  2. Press Enter or click the arrow button to submit it.

The system will verify the key. If it is valid, the chat interface will load. Your key is saved on your device so you do not need to re-enter it next time.

Invalid API Key

If the key is rejected, check that you have entered it correctly. An error message will appear beneath the field if the key is not recognised.

Service unavailable

If the message "DINO-AI is not responding at the moment" appears, the service may be temporarily unavailable. Try again later.

docs.title: Asking Questions
docs.text:
Once the chat is ready, you will see a preview of your data and a text input at the bottom of the screen.

  1. Click inside the text field and type your question (for example: "How many entries were submitted last month?" or "Show me a chart of responses by location").
  2. Press Enter to send.
  3. The assistant will process your question and display the answer in the chat history above. Responses may appear as text, tables, or charts.

You can continue the conversation by asking follow-up questions. If the assistant suggests follow-up questions, you can click on them to send them directly.

docs.title: Providing Feedback
docs.text: Each response includes a thumbs-up and thumbs-down button. Use these to rate the quality of the answer. Your feedback helps improve the assistant over time.

docs.title: "No Forms were found"
docs.text:
Warning

There are no submissions associated with this form yet. Add some entries using the submissions list before using Data Chat.

docs.title: "Sorry, you don't have enough Credits!"
docs.text:
Warning

Your account has run out of DataChat credits. A link may appear to purchase additional credits. If you need help, contact your administrator.

docs.title: Filling In a Form
docs.text: This page explains how to fill in a new form submission. You can start a new submission by selecting a form from the list and clicking the + button.

docs.title: Selecting Metrics
docs.text:
Optional Step

This step only appears if your form uses contextual metrics (like projects or locations). If you see the form fields directly, skip to the next section.

The first step is to select the context for your submission. This links your data to specific projects, locations, or other categories.

  1. Use the dropdown menus to choose a value for each required metric.
  2. Click Go to form or the forward arrow to proceed to the data entry fields.

You can return to this step at any time by clicking the back arrow at the top of the page.

Audio Input

If a microphone button is visible, you can record a spoken response. Dino will attempt to transcribe it and fill in the relevant fields automatically.

docs.title: Filling In the Form Fields
docs.text:
Enter your data into the fields on the page. Fields marked as required must be completed before you can save the final submission.

If the form is divided into multiple sections, you can switch between them using the tabs or navigation bar near the top of the form.

A status bar may show the current workflow stage of your submission.

docs.title: Saving Your Submission
docs.text:
Once you have entered your data, use the buttons in the bottom-right corner to save:

  • Save form (floppy disk icon): Saves the submission as final. This button is only active when all required fields are correctly filled.
  • Save draft (save-as icon): Saves your progress without completing all validation. Use this to finish your submission later.

Offline File Uploads

If your form includes file attachments and you are working offline, a warning will appear when you save. The submission data will be saved, but the attached files will queue for upload once you are back online.

A confirmation message will appear when your submission has been saved successfully.

docs.title: Managing Form Schemas
docs.text:
Form schemas define the structure and fields used when collecting data. Administrators and users with the appropriate permissions can create new schemas, edit existing ones, and configure how they behave.

Permission required

Managing form schemas requires specific permissions. If you cannot see the create or edit options, contact your administrator.

docs.title: Accessing Schema Management
docs.text: From the Data Collection hub, navigate to the schema you want to edit and click its edit action, or use the navigation to reach the Create option for a new schema. Both paths open the same schema editor.

docs.title: Schema Settings
docs.text:
At the top of the editor, fill in the following fields before designing the form structure:

  • Form Name — a unique internal identifier for this schema. An error will appear if the name is already in use.
  • Form Label — the display name shown to users in the interface.
  • Icon Set — choose between Default (standard icons) and Humanitarian (icons specific to humanitarian contexts).
  • Icon Identifier — type to search for and select the icon that represents this form.
  • Form Statuses — select one or more workflow statuses that entries created with this schema can move through. You can also create new statuses or edit existing ones inline: click the edit icon next to a status, or select Create new Status at the bottom of the dropdown.
  • Form Metrics — select the metric types (such as project, location, or organisation) that entries created with this schema will be linked to.
  • Visibility — set to Private (accessible only to authorised users) or Public (shareable via a public link).
  • Metrics Set Behavior — Default allows multiple entries with the same metric combination; Unique prevents duplicate metric sets for this form.
  • Generate Report — if set to Yes, an automatic report will be generated and linked to this schema when it is saved. This option is only shown if no auto-report already exists for the schema.

docs.title: Building the Form Structure
docs.text:
The lower section of the page contains the form builder, where you can add, arrange, and configure the fields that will appear when users fill in this form.

Use the form builder controls to:

  • Add new fields (text, number, date, file, choice, and more)
  • Organise fields into pages or sections
  • Set field labels, hints, and validation rules

The Save button remains disabled if the form builder reports any validation errors. Resolve all errors before attempting to save.

docs.title: Importing a Form Structure
docs.text:
If you have an existing form definition in XLSForm format, you can import it instead of building the structure manually.

  1. Click the Import button in the toolbar.
  2. Select your XLSForm file from your device.
  3. Review the imported structure in the form builder.
  4. Make any adjustments needed, then save.

docs.title: Configuring Relationships
docs.text:
Existing schemas only

The Relationships button is only available when editing an existing schema, not when creating a new one.

Click the Relationships button to open the relationships editor. This lets you link fields in this form to data from other forms, so that certain field values or dropdown choices can be pre-filled based on related form data.

docs.title: Saving the Schema
docs.text:
Click Save to save the schema. A confirmation message will appear briefly at the bottom of the screen.

After saving, you will be returned to the Data Collection hub.

Oops! Something went wrong saving the Form

If an error message appears when saving, check that the Form Name and Form Label fields are filled in and that the Form Name is not already used by another schema. If the problem persists, contact your administrator.

docs.title: Exploring Data on a Map
docs.text: The Map View shows all submissions for a form on an interactive map. Submissions are displayed as markers, which are grouped into clusters when many points are close together. You can use the filters on the left to narrow down the data displayed.

docs.title: Using the Map
docs.text:
1. Navigate the Map:
    • Pan: Click and drag the map to move it.
    • Zoom: Use the scroll wheel on your mouse or the + (zoom in) and - (zoom out) buttons in the bottom-right corner of the map.
  2. View Submission Details:
    • Click on a cluster to zoom in and break it into individual markers.
    • Click on a single marker to open a popup with details for that specific submission, such as the location and key data from the form.

Finding Your Data

When you first open the map, it will automatically zoom and center to show all available submissions for the current form.

docs.title: Filtering Submissions on the Map
docs.text:
A filter panel on the left side allows you to narrow down which submissions are shown on the map.

  1. Set a Date Range:

    • Use the Date range picker to select a start ("From date") and end ("To date"). Only submissions created within this period will be displayed.

  2. Filter by Form Data:

    • Additional filter fields (like Area, Case, Organization, or Project) appear based on the form's schema and the data collected.
    • Click into a filter field to see an autocomplete list of all values that exist for that field in your data.
    • Start typing to narrow the list, or select a specific value from the dropdown.

  3. Apply Your Filters:

    • After setting your date range and any other filters, click the Apply Filters button.
    • The map will refresh, showing only the markers that match all your selected criteria. The map will also re-center to fit the filtered results.

Clearing Filters

To clear a text filter, click the X icon inside its field. To clear the date range, delete the text in the date inputs. You must click Apply Filters after clearing for the changes to take effect.

docs.title: Viewing & Managing Submissions
docs.text: This page shows all submissions for a specific form schema. You can browse, search, view details, edit, export, and manage individual entries from this list.

docs.title: Browsing the List
docs.text:
The list displays all submissions for the selected form. The total number of entries matching your current filters is shown at the top.

Use the pagination controls to move between pages, or jump to the first or last page.

You can also change which columns are visible by clicking the column selector button (grid icon) in the table header.

docs.title: Searching and Filtering
docs.text:
A filter bar above the list lets you narrow down which entries are shown:

  • Keyword search — type any word to filter entries whose fields contain that text.
  • From date / To date — show only entries created within a date range.
  • Metric filters — filter by project, location, area, case, organization, or other linked data.
  • Status filter — show only entries with a specific workflow status.
  • User filter — show only entries created by a specific user or user group.
  • Saved filters (presets) — save your current filter combination as a preset for quick access later. Use the preset menu in the filter bar to save, load, or delete presets.

To remove a filter, click the × inside that field.

docs.title: Row Actions
docs.text:
Each row has a set of action icons on the right. The actions available depend on your permissions:

  • View (eye icon) — open the entry in read-only mode.
  • Edit (pencil icon) — open the entry for editing.
  • Print (printer icon) — generate a PDF version of the entry.
  • Export as Word (document icon) — download the entry as a Word document.
  • Duplicate (copy icon) — create a new draft entry pre-filled with this entry's data.
  • Delete (bin icon) — permanently delete the entry. A confirmation prompt will appear.
  • Print badge (badge icon) — generate a badge document for this entry (available if the form is linked to a case).
  • View log (history icon) — see the history of changes made to this entry.

Permission-based actions

Not all actions are visible to every user. The actions shown depend on your assigned permissions. Some actions, like edit or delete, may only be available if the entry's status allows it.

docs.title: Bulk Actions
docs.text:
To act on multiple entries at once:

  1. Select the entries you want to manage by ticking the checkbox on their rows.
  2. Use the bulk action buttons that appear in the toolbar to delete or edit all selected entries at once.

Bulk edit restrictions

Bulk editing is only available if all selected entries have a status that permits editing.

docs.title: Adding a New Entry
docs.text: Click the + button (floating circular button at the bottom-right of the page) to open a blank form and record a new submission.

docs.title: Importing Entries
docs.text: Click the import button (cloud upload icon, floating button at the bottom-right) to bulk-import entries from a file.

docs.title: Exporting the List
docs.text: Click the Export button (download icon) in the filter bar to download the current list of entries as a file.

docs.title: Viewing Data on a Map
docs.text: If submissions include geographic data, click the Map button in the filter bar to open the Map View for this form.

docs.title: Logging In to Dino
docs.text: The Login page is the starting point of your Dino experience. From here you can sign in to your account, create a new account, or recover access if you have forgotten your password. Depending on how your organisation has set up Dino, some of the options described below may not be visible in your installation.

docs.title: Signing In
docs.text:
Use your credentials to access the platform.

  1. On the Login page, enter your username or email address in the first field.
  2. Enter your password in the second field.
  3. Click the arrow button to sign in.

If your credentials are correct, you will be taken to the Dashboard automatically.

If the sign-in fails, an error message will appear below the form. Double-check that your email and password are correct, making sure there are no extra spaces, and try again.

docs.title: Resetting Your Password
docs.text:
If you have forgotten your password, you can request a reset link by email.

Optional feature

This option may not be available in your installation. If you do not see the "Forgot your password?" link, contact your administrator.

  1. On the Login page, click "Forgot your password?" below the sign-in form.
  2. Enter the email address associated with your account.
  3. Click the arrow button to send the request.

You will receive a confirmation message at the top of the screen. Check your inbox for an email containing a link to set a new password. If the email does not arrive within a few minutes, check your spam folder.

To go back to the sign-in form without resetting your password, click "Actually, I do remember my password".

docs.title: Creating a New Account
docs.text:
If you do not have an account yet, you may be able to register directly from the Login page.

Optional feature

This option may not be available in your installation. If you do not see the "New User? Create new account" link, contact your administrator to have an account created for you.

  1. On the Login page, click "New User? Create new account".
  2. Enter your full name.
  3. Enter your email address.
  4. Choose a password (at least 9 characters long).
  5. Re-enter your password in the Confirm Password field to make sure it matches.
  6. If a Privacy Policy is shown, read the text and tick the checkbox to accept the terms and conditions. You must accept in order to proceed.
  7. Click the arrow button to create your account.

Once your account is created you will be signed in and taken to the Dashboard automatically.

If you already have an account, click "Already have an account? Login" to return to the sign-in form.

docs.title: Signing In with an External Account
docs.text:
Your organisation may allow you to sign in using your existing Microsoft or Google account, instead of a separate Dino password.

Optional feature

This option may not be available in your installation. The buttons will only appear if your administrator has enabled external login.

  1. On the Login page, click "Login with Microsoft" or "Login with Google", depending on which account you want to use.
  2. You will be redirected to Microsoft or Google to confirm your identity.
  3. After authorising access, you will be brought back to Dino and signed in automatically.

docs.title: Page Settings
docs.text: A small set of display preferences are available directly on the Login page.

docs.title: Light / Dark Theme
docs.text: A toggle is available at the bottom of the form, between a sun icon and a moon icon. Click or slide it to switch between light mode and dark mode. This setting takes effect immediately.

docs.title: Platform Selection
docs.text:
Optional feature

This option may not be available in your installation. It is only shown in multi-platform deployments.

If a "Choose your platform" dropdown is visible, select the platform you want to connect to before signing in. The dropdown will list the environments your administrator has configured.

docs.title: "There was a problem connecting to the Authentication server or your token has expired."
docs.text:
Warning

Your previous session has expired or the connection to the authentication server was interrupted. This is not an error on your part. Simply enter your credentials and sign in again.

docs.title: "There was a problem during syncing process."
docs.text:
Warning

An error occurred while synchronising your data, which may be related to a recent form import. Review any forms you were importing for potential issues, then sign in again. If the problem persists, contact your administrator.

docs.title: "Loading external authentication…" with no redirect
docs.text:
Warning

This message appears briefly when completing a sign-in via Microsoft or Google. If the page does not proceed automatically after a few seconds, try signing in again. If the problem repeats, contact your administrator to check that the external authentication service is correctly configured.

docs.title: Resetting Your Password
docs.text:
The Reset Password page lets you choose a new password after requesting a reset link. You arrive here by clicking the link sent to your email address — the same link you requested from the "Forgot your password?" option on the Login page.

Note

If you have not yet requested a reset link, go to the Login page first and click "Forgot your password?".

docs.title: Setting a New Password
docs.text:
1. Open the password reset link from your email. This will bring you directly to the Reset Password page.
  2. Enter your new password in the first field. Your password must be at least 9 characters long.
  3. Re-enter the same password in the Confirm New Password field to make sure it matches.
  4. Click the arrow button to confirm your new password.

If the password is accepted, a confirmation message will appear at the top of the screen and you will be automatically redirected to the Login page after a few seconds. You can then sign in with your new password.

docs.title: "Your Reset Password ticket is invalid or expired. Please try again."
docs.text:
Warning

The link you used is no longer valid. Reset links expire after a short time for security reasons. Go back to the Login page, click "Forgot your password?" again, and request a new link.

docs.title: "Incorrect password"
docs.text:
Warning

The password could not be saved. Make sure both fields contain exactly the same password and that it is at least 9 characters long, then try again. If the problem persists, request a new reset link from the Login page.

docs.title: The page does not redirect after a successful reset
docs.text:
Tip

If the confirmation message appears but the page does not redirect to the Login page on its own, navigate there manually. Your password has already been changed successfully.

docs.title: DinoGPT
docs.text:
DinoGPT is an AI assistant that lets you ask plain-language questions and receive answers drawn from a configured knowledge base. It is designed for direct conversation — you type a question and receive a response, along with references to the source documents the answer is based on.

Optional feature

This feature requires a DINO-AI API key and may not be available in your installation. If you cannot see this option, contact your administrator.

docs.title: Accepting the Terms of Use
docs.text:
The first time you open DinoGPT, you will be shown a terms of use statement explaining how the assistant works, what it can and cannot do, and your responsibilities as a user. Read the terms and click Accept to continue.

Your acceptance is saved on your device, so you will not be asked again on future visits.

docs.title: Entering Your API Key
docs.text:
After accepting the terms, you will be asked to enter your DINO-AI API key.

  1. Type your API key into the field.
  2. Press Enter or click the arrow button to submit it.

The system will verify the key. If it is valid, a confirmation message will appear and the chat interface will load. Your key is saved on your device so you do not need to re-enter it next time.

Invalid API Key

If the key is rejected, check that you have entered it correctly. An error message will appear beneath the field if the key is not recognised.

Service unavailable

If the message "DINO-AI is not responding at the moment" appears, the service may be temporarily unavailable. Try again later.

docs.title: Asking Questions
docs.text:
Once the chat is ready, the assistant will greet you and a text input will appear at the bottom of the screen.

  1. Select a Namespace from the dropdown to choose which knowledge base the assistant should draw from.
  2. Click inside the text field and type your question.
  3. Press Enter to send.
  4. The assistant will process your question and display the answer in the chat history above.

You can continue the conversation by asking follow-up questions. The assistant takes the full conversation history into account when generating each response.

docs.title: Understanding Responses
docs.text:
Each response from the assistant may include:

  • Answer text — the assistant's response to your question.
  • Sources — clickable chips showing the document or file the answer was drawn from, along with the page number if available. Click a source chip to read the relevant passage.
  • Suggested questions — clickable chips with follow-up questions suggested by the assistant. Click one to send it directly.

docs.title: Providing Feedback
docs.text: Responses include a thumbs-up and thumbs-down button. Use these to rate the quality of the answer. A confirmation message will appear when your feedback is sent.

docs.title: Chat has reached its maximum length
docs.text:
Warning

If the assistant replies that the chat has reached its maximum length, reload the page to start a new conversation.

docs.title: "Sorry, you don't have enough Credits!"
docs.text:
Warning

Your account has run out of DINO-AI credits. A link may appear to purchase additional credits. If you need help, contact your administrator.

docs.title: Navigation & Interface
docs.text: The Dino interface consists of a top toolbar and a side navigation menu that are present on every page after you log in.

docs.title: Side Navigation
docs.text:
The side menu lets you move between the main areas of the application.

Standard sections (visible to all authenticated users):

Section Description Dashboard The home screen. Forms Data collection forms and submissions. Aggregation Unified view of submissions across multiple forms. Reports Generated reports. Metrics Reference data (projects, locations, organisations, etc.). (Hidden for guest-only users.) GPT AI assistant (DinoGPT).

Admin sections (visible to administrators only, shown below a divider):

Section Description Users User accounts and permission groups. Languages Interface translation management.

On large screens the menu is always visible on the left. On smaller screens it collapses and can be opened with the menu button (hamburger icon) in the top toolbar. On either screen size, click the menu button to expand the menu labels or collapse them to icons only.

docs.title: Top Toolbar
docs.text:
The toolbar at the top of the screen contains the following controls, from left to right:

  • Menu toggle — open or collapse the side menu.
  • Logo — displays your organisation's logo.
  • New version indicator — a download icon appears when a new version of Dino is available. Click it to reload the application and apply the update.
  • DINO-AI Credits — shows your remaining AI credit balance as a badge. Click to open the User Area on the Credits panel. (Only visible if a DINO-AI API key has been configured.)
  • Dark / Light mode toggle — a sun icon, a slider, and a moon icon. Use the slider to switch between light and dark themes. (Hidden on mobile — use the User Area instead.)
  • Info icon — hover to see version information for this installation.
  • Help icon — opens the Dino tutorial playlist in a new tab.
  • Settings icon — opens the User Area.
  • Sync icon — shows the current data synchronisation status. Click to trigger a manual sync.
  • Notifications bell — shows the number of unread notifications as a badge. The bell rings when new notifications arrive. See Notifications below.
  • Language selector — switch the interface language.
  • User name — click to open the User Area.
  • Logout icon — click to log out. The icon is greyed out while a sync is in progress or when the device is offline; logout is unavailable in those states.

docs.title: Data Synchronisation
docs.text:
Dino synchronises your data with the server in the background. The sync icon in the toolbar shows the current state:

Icon Meaning sync (static) All data is up to date. sync_problem (pulsing) You have local changes that have not been synced yet. Click to trigger a sync. sync (spinning) A sync is currently in progress. sync_disabled The device is offline; sync is not available. sync with ! badge A sync problem was encountered. Check your notifications for details.

When a sync completes, a notification appears briefly at the bottom of the screen:

  • "Synchronization complete" — all data synced successfully.
  • "Synchronization complete with errors. Could not synchronize: [items]. Please check your notifications." — one or more data collections could not be synced. A notification is also created in your notification list.

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Click the bell icon in the toolbar to open the notifications dropdown. The badge on the bell shows the number of unread messages.

From the dropdown you can:

  • Click a notification to mark it as read.
  • Click the arrow button on a notification (if present) to navigate directly to the relevant area of the application.
  • Mark all as read — marks all current notifications as read.
  • View all notifications — navigates to the full Notifications page.

docs.title: User Area
docs.text: Click the settings icon, your user name, or the DINO-AI Credits counter to open the User Area dialog. It shows your full name and email address at the top, and contains the following sections:

docs.title: Change Password
docs.text: Enter your Current Password, a New Password, and Confirm New Password, then click the arrow button to save. An error message will appear if the current password is incorrect or if the new passwords do not match.

docs.title: API Keys
docs.text: View or set your DINO-AI API Key. Once a valid key is stored it is shown in read-only mode. Use the eye icon to show or hide the key, and the copy icon to copy it to the clipboard.

docs.title: Credits
docs.text:
Shows your current DINO-AI credit balance. If a payment integration is configured, an Add more button is available to purchase additional credits.

(This section is only visible when a DINO-AI API key has been configured.)

docs.title: DINO Theme
docs.text:
Customise the application colour scheme:

  • Primary color, Accent color, Warning color — click the colour fields to open a colour picker.
  • Preset name — type or select a name to save or load a colour preset.
  • Click Save to save the current colours as a named preset, or Load to apply a saved preset.

On mobile, a dark / light mode toggle also appears here.

docs.title: Tutorials
docs.text:
Click Start Dino Tour to restart the guided tour of the application from the beginning.

(This section is only shown if the guided tour is configured in your installation.)

docs.title: Backup and Restore
docs.text:
(Administrators only, if enabled.)

  • Backup Data — downloads a full export of the application database as a JSON file.
  • Restore Data — uploads a previously exported JSON file to restore the database.

docs.title: Metrics
docs.text:
Metrics are the reference data categories used across Dino to classify, organize, and filter your collected data. When filling in a form or generating a report, you select values from these categories — for example, choosing a project, a location, or an organization.

The Metrics area is where you manage the lists of available values for each category. It serves as the central hub for all your reference data.

docs.title: Metric Types
docs.text:
The main page displays the metric types that are active in your Dino installation. Each type is shown as a card with an icon and label. Click on any card to open its management page.

Depending on your system configuration, some or all of the following metric types may be available:

Metric Type Description Thematic Areas Areas of work or thematic groupings for your activities. Cases Individual cases, people, or beneficiaries tracked across form submissions. Locations Geographic locations where data is collected or activities occur. Projects Projects that form submissions and reports are linked to. Organizations Organizations involved in or responsible for activities.

Accessing Metrics

You can navigate to the Metrics area by clicking Metrics in the main application menu.

docs.title: What You Can Do
docs.text:
From the main Metrics page, you can:

  1. View all active metric types available for your data.
  2. Navigate to a specific metric type by clicking its card. This takes you to a dedicated page where you can manage the list of values for that type (e.g., add a new location or edit a project name).
  3. Use breadcrumbs at the top of the page to track your navigation path within the Metrics section.

For detailed instructions on adding, editing, or deleting values within a specific metric type, see Managing Metrics.

docs.title: Managing Metrics
docs.text:
In Dino, you can manage different types of structured data, called metrics. These include Thematic Areas, Cases, Locations, Projects, and Organisations. You access each type from the main navigation. Each metric type has a dedicated management page with a consistent layout for viewing and managing its entries.

Permission required

Managing metric values requires specific permissions. If you cannot see the create, edit, or delete options, contact your administrator.

docs.title: Browsing the List
docs.text:
The main page shows a list of all entries for the selected metric type. You can:

  • Search and Filter: Use the search bar above the list to find entries by name or other attributes.
  • Sort: Click on column headers marked with a sort icon to reorder the list.
  • Export: Click the Export button in the toolbar to download the current list as a file.
  • Select or Expand: Click anywhere on a row to select it. Click the expand icon to see more details.

docs.title: Creating a New Entry
docs.text:
1. Click the + button (the circular floating button at the bottom-right of the screen).
  2. A dialog will open with fields for the new entry.
  3. Fill in the required information and click Save.

docs.title: Editing or Viewing an Entry
docs.text:
Each row in the list has action icons on the right side.

  1. To view an entry's details without editing, click the View (eye) icon.
  2. To edit an entry, click the Edit (pencil) icon.
  3. The same editor dialog opens, populated with the entry's current data. Make your changes and click Save.

docs.title: Deleting Entries
docs.text:
You can delete entries individually or in bulk.

To delete a single entry: 1. Click the Delete (trash can) icon on the row you wish to remove. 2. A confirmation dialog will appear. Click Confirm to permanently delete the entry.

To delete multiple entries: 1. Select the entries by checking the boxes on their rows. 2. A toolbar will appear. Click the Delete action in this toolbar. 3. Confirm the deletion in the dialog that appears.

docs.title: Importing Entries in Bulk
docs.text:
You can add many entries at once by importing them from a file.

  1. Click the Import (cloud upload) button, which is a floating button at the bottom-right of the screen.
  2. In the dialog, click Choose file and select an .xls, .xlsx, or .csv file from your device.
  3. (Optional) Check the box for Don't import metrics if name exists to avoid creating duplicate entries.
  4. Click Apply to start the import.
  5. Click Close when the process is complete.

docs.title: Understanding the Entry Editor
docs.text: When you create, edit, or view an entry, a dialog opens with its fields. The available fields depend on the metric type.

docs.title: Common Fields
docs.text:
• Name (Required): The display name for this entry. It must be unique within its metric type.
  • Parent: An optional field to link this entry to a parent, creating a hierarchy (e.g., a sub-project within a project). Start typing to search for and select a parent.

docs.title: Metric-Specific Fields
docs.text: Metric Type Key Fields (Beyond Name & Parent) Thematic Areas No additional standard fields. Cases Code (read-only), Image (upload or take a photo). Locations Coordinates. Organisations Logo Path, Website URL. Projects Code, Sectors of Intervention, Donors, Start Date, End Date.

docs.title: Additional Attributes
docs.text: Below the standard fields, you will find an Additional attributes section. Here you can attach custom key-value pairs to an entry. * Click + to add a new attribute row. * Click - next to an attribute to remove it. * This section is hidden in view mode if no custom attributes exist.

docs.title: Saving Your Work
docs.text:
Click Save to create or update the entry. A brief confirmation message will appear.

Saving Errors

If you see an error when saving, check that all required fields are filled and that the entry name is not already in use. If the problem continues, contact your administrator.

Offline Image Upload

If you save an entry with an image while offline, the image will not be uploaded. You must save the entry again once you are back online to upload the image file.

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text: The Notifications page shows all messages sent to you by the system or your administrator. From here you can browse, search, and open individual notifications, including ones that link directly to a relevant area of the application.

docs.title: Reading Your Notifications
docs.text:
The list displays every notification you have received, showing its message text and the date it was created.

Notifications you have not yet opened appear highlighted in the list so you can spot them at a glance. A small link icon next to the message text indicates that the notification will take you somewhere when clicked.

The total number of notifications matching your current search is shown at the top of the page.

docs.title: Searching and Filtering
docs.text: Use the filter bar above the list to narrow down what is shown.

docs.title: Search by keyword
docs.text:
1. Click inside the search by keyword field at the top of the list.
  2. Start typing any word or phrase from the notification text.
  3. The list updates automatically as you type.
  4. To clear the search, click the × icon that appears inside the field.

docs.title: Filter by date
docs.text:
1. Click the From date field and select a start date from the calendar.
  2. Click the To date field and select an end date.
  3. The list will show only notifications created within that date range.
  4. To remove a date filter, click the × icon next to the relevant field.

docs.title: Navigating the List
docs.text: If there are more notifications than fit on one page, use the pagination controls at the top of the list to move between pages. You can jump to the first or last page, or step forward and backward one page at a time.

docs.title: Opening a Notification
docs.text:
Click on any row to open that notification.

  • If the notification contains a link (shown by the link icon next to the message), clicking it will mark the notification as read and take you directly to the relevant page in the application.
  • If the notification does not contain a link, clicking it will expand the row to show its full content in place.

To collapse an expanded notification, click its row again.

To expand or collapse all rows at once, use the fold/unfold button above the list.

docs.title: Customising the Columns
docs.text:
You can change which columns are visible in the list.

  1. Click the column selector button (grid icon) in the top-right corner of the table header.
  2. A panel will open showing all available columns.
  3. Toggle the columns you want to show or hide.
  4. Close the panel when done — your selection is applied immediately.

docs.title: Public Forms
docs.text: Public forms allow anyone with a link to submit data to Dino without needing to log in or have an account. This is commonly used for surveys, registrations, or feedback collection. If you have received a public link to a form, you can use this page to complete it.

docs.title: Accessing a Public Form
docs.text:
1. Click the public form link you received (e.g., via email or a shared message).
  2. The form will open directly in your web browser. You do not need to sign in.
  3. Review the form title and any introductory text to confirm it's the correct form.

Tip

Public form links are unique and often contain a long identifier (like /f/abc123def). If the page doesn't load, ensure the entire link was copied correctly.

docs.title: Completing and Submitting
docs.text:
1. Fill in all the fields on the form. Fields marked with an asterisk () are required*.
  2. If the form has multiple sections, use the navigation tabs or buttons at the top of the form to move between them.
  3. As you fill out fields, the form validates your input. Invalid entries are typically highlighted.
  4. Once all required fields are valid, the primary submit button (usually a circular button with a send icon) will become active.
  5. Click the submit button to send your data.

Warning

The submit button will remain disabled (greyed out) if any required field is empty or contains invalid data. Scroll through the form to find and correct any highlighted issues.

docs.title: After Submission
docs.text:
Upon a successful submission, you will see a confirmation screen with a checkmark and the message: "The form has been successfully submitted."

A notification will also appear at the bottom of your screen. From this notification, you can: * Fill out another one: Click this to reload the page with a fresh, empty copy of the same form, allowing you to make another submission. * Close: Dismiss the notification.

docs.title: The submit button is disabled.
docs.text: This means the form is not yet valid. Check for: * Empty required fields: Ensure all fields marked with an asterisk () are filled. * Invalid data*: Look for fields highlighted in red and correct the information (e.g., an invalid email format).

docs.title: "Unable to save form."
docs.text: Your submission encountered a temporary error, often related to your internet connection. 1. Click "Try again" in the notification at the bottom of the screen. 2. If the error persists, check your internet connection and try refreshing the page. 3. If it continues to fail, contact the person who sent you the form link.

docs.title: "Oops! We could not find this Form Schema."
docs.text: The link you are using is incorrect or the form has been removed. * Verify you have the complete, correct URL. * Contact the person who shared the link with you for an updated one.

docs.title: The form does not load (blank page).
docs.text:
• Refresh your browser page.
  • Ensure your internet connection is stable.
  • Confirm the link is complete and has not been truncated.

docs.title: Reports
docs.text: The Reports area is your hub for accessing all available report schemas. A report schema defines the structure and content of a report that can be generated from your collected data. From here, you can browse schemas and access the reports that have already been created.

docs.title: Browsing Report Schemas
docs.text:
When you open the Reports page, you see a list of all report schemas you have permission to access. The list is sorted alphabetically by the schema's label.

To find a specific schema: 1. Use the search bar at the top of the page. 2. Type any part of the schema's name or label. 3. The list will filter in real-time to show only matching schemas.

To view the reports for a specific schema, click on its card in the list.

Getting Started

If you see the message "There are no reports," it means no report schemas have been created yet or shared with you. Contact your Dino administrator to get started.

docs.title: What You Can Do
docs.text:
From the main Reports page, you can navigate to perform these key actions:

  • Creating a Report — Generate a new report document by selecting a schema, choosing your metrics, and setting a date range.
  • Viewing & Managing Reports — Browse, view, export, favorite, or delete reports that have already been generated.
  • Managing Report Schemas — Create new report schemas or edit existing ones to define what data appears in reports. This typically requires administrator permissions.

docs.title: Creating a Report
docs.text:
To generate a new report, navigate to the Reports hub, open a report schema, and click the + button (the floating circular button at the bottom-right of the page).

Permission required

The add button is only visible if you have permission to create reports for this schema.

docs.title: Step 1 — Report Metrics
docs.text:
If the report schema requires metrics, the first step asks you to select the metric values that this report will cover (for example: project, location, or organisation).

  1. Fill in all required metric fields.
  2. Click Next to continue.

docs.title: Step 2 — Report Data
docs.text:
In the second step, fill in the following fields:

  • Report Name (required) — A name to identify this report.
  • Collected Since (optional) — The start of the date range for data included in the report.
  • Collected Until (optional) — The end of the date range.

The date range is optional. If left blank, the report will include all available data for the selected metrics.

Schemas without metrics

If the report schema does not use metrics, you will see only the report name and date range fields directly, with no stepper.

docs.title: Saving the Report
docs.text:
Click the Save report button (the floating circular button) to generate and save the report.

  • If the report is generated successfully, a confirmation message will appear and you will be returned to the reports list.

AI-powered reports

Some report schemas use AI to generate content. Creating a report from these schemas costs AI credits. The credit cost is shown on the add button tooltip before you begin. If your account does not have enough credits, a message will appear and the report cannot be created.

docs.title: Managing Report Schemas
docs.text:
Report schemas define the structure and layout of generated reports. Administrators and users with the appropriate permissions can create new schemas and edit existing ones.

Permission required

Managing report schemas requires specific permissions. If you cannot see the create or edit options, contact your administrator.

docs.title: Accessing Schema Management
docs.text: From the Reports hub, navigate to the schema you want to edit and click its edit action, or use the navigation to reach the Create option for a new schema.

docs.title: Schema Settings
docs.text:
Fill in the following fields to configure the schema:

  • Report Name — a unique internal identifier for this schema. An error will appear if the name is already in use.
  • Report Label — the display name shown to users in the interface.
  • Icon Set — choose between Default (standard icons) and Humanitarian (icons specific to humanitarian contexts).
  • Icon Identifier — type to search for and select the icon that represents this schema.
  • Required Metrics — select one or more metric types (such as project, location, or organisation) that must be provided when generating a report from this schema.

docs.title: Associated Form Schemas
docs.text: Below the settings fields, a read-only section lists the form schemas linked to this report schema. These are set by the system and cannot be changed from this screen.

docs.title: Report Preview
docs.text: A live preview of the report layout is displayed on the right side of the screen. The preview updates as you make changes to the schema structure.

docs.title: Importing a Report Structure
docs.text:
If you have an existing report definition in XLS format, you can import it instead of building the structure manually.

  1. Click the Import button.
  2. Select your XLS file from your device.
  3. Review the imported structure in the editor.
  4. Make any adjustments needed, then save.

docs.title: Saving the Schema
docs.text:
Click Save to save the schema. A confirmation message will appear briefly at the bottom of the screen. After saving, you will be returned to the Reports hub.

Oops! Something went wrong saving the Report

If an error message appears when saving, check that the Report Name and Report Label fields are filled in and that the Report Name is not already used by another schema. If the problem persists, contact your administrator.

docs.title: Viewing & Managing Reports
docs.text: This page lists all the reports generated from a specific report schema. You can browse, search, view, export, mark as favourite, and delete individual reports from this central list.

docs.title: Browsing the List
docs.text:
The list displays all reports for the selected schema. Each row represents one report.

The list includes the following columns:

  • User: The person who created the report.
  • Name: The title of the report.
  • Status: The current status of the report.
  • Collected Since / Collected Until: The date range of data included in the report.
  • Creation Date: When the report was created.
  • Project, Location, Area, Case, Organization: These columns appear only if the corresponding metric types are active in your workspace.

Use the pagination controls at the bottom of the list to navigate between pages.

docs.title: Searching and Filtering
docs.text:
Use the filter bar above the list to narrow down the reports shown.

  1. Click on any filter field (like Project or Location) to select specific values.
  2. You can combine multiple filters.
  3. To save your filter combination for later use, click the preset menu icon in the filter bar and select Save as preset.
  4. To load a saved filter, open the preset menu and select the preset name.

docs.title: Actions on Reports
docs.text:
Each report row has action icons on the right. The actions available to you depend on your user permissions.

  • View (): Opens the report in a read-only view.
  • Add to favourites (): Marks this report as a favourite for quick access.
  • Remove from favourites (): Removes the report from your favourites list.
  • Delete (): Permanently deletes the report. You will be asked to confirm this action.

Permission-based actions

You may not see all actions. The icons displayed are based on the permissions granted to your user role.

docs.title: Adding a New Report
docs.text:
A floating + button is available if you have permission to create new reports for this schema.

  1. Click the + button.
  2. If the report schema uses AI features, a tooltip will show how many credits will be used. The report creation will proceed automatically.

Insufficient Credits

If you do not have enough AI credits, a warning message will appear. You will need to add more credits to your account before you can create this report.

docs.title: Viewing a Report
docs.text: To view a report, click its row in the list or use the View action icon.

docs.title: 1. Selecting Metrics
docs.text:
If the report schema is linked to metrics, you will first see a metrics selection step.

  1. Choose values for the required metrics (e.g., Project, Location).
  2. Adjust the Date Start and Date End if needed.
  3. Click Next to generate and load the report.

docs.title: 2. Report Display
docs.text:
The report view shows the report title, date range, selected metrics, and the main report content, which is structured according to its schema.

AI-generated content

If the report includes AI-generated text, you will see a progress indicator (e.g., "Generating report prompt 1 of 3") while the content is prepared. This happens automatically.

docs.title: 3. Exporting a Report
docs.text:
From the report view, you can export it in different formats.

  • PDF: Click the PDF button to download a PDF file.
  • Excel (XLSX): Click the Excel button to download a spreadsheet.
  • Word (DOCX): Click the Word button to download a Word document.

No exportable content

If you try to export to Excel and see a message that "No exportable widget was found," it means the report does not contain any table or chart data that can be put into a spreadsheet.

docs.title: "No Forms were found for this Report"
docs.text:
Warning

This error means the report could not be generated because there is no submitted data linked to it. Ensure that form submissions have been collected using the form schema connected to this report before trying to view it.
